xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This module contains functions to connect to any JDBC datasource using jvm-util module to handle Java interaction.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:author: Rodolfo Ochoa

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This variable represents the NOT-SUPPORTED level for Isolation Levels in $options for 2.2 connect function.
This variable represents the READ-COMMITTED level for Isolation Levels in $options for 2.2 connect function.
This variable represents the READ-UNCOMMITTED level for Isolation Levels in $options for 2.2 connect function.
This variable represents the REPEATABLE-READ level for Isolation Levels in $options for 2.2 connect function.
This variable represents the SERIALIZABLE level for Isolation Levels in $options for 2.2 connect function.

Opens a connection to a database. Returns a URI identifying the connection that has been opened. The implementing code determines from the $connection-config either explicitly (interpreting the driver attribute) or implicitly (using the type attribute) which driver it has to load.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $connection-config json object that has the host and user informations.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: Return an identifier that represents the connection to the server. Connection coonfiguration example: { "url" : "jdbc:mysql://localhost/", "user" : "root", "password" : "" }
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: SQL001 Descriptive error, see attached message.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: jdbc:connect
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:sequential function jdbc:connect($connection-config as object()) as xs:anyURI external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Opens a connection to a database with specified options. Returns a URI identifying the connection that has been opened. The implementing code determines from the $connection-config either explicitly (interpreting the driver attribute) or implicitly (using the type attribute) which driver it has to load.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $connection-config json object that has the host and user informations.
$options json object that specifies the connection options.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: Return an identifier that represents the connection to the server. Connection options example: { "autocommit" : false, "readonly"? : true, "isolation-level"? : $jdbc:READ-COMMITTED }
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: jdbc:connect
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:sequential function jdbc:connect($connection-config as object(), $options as object()?) as xs:anyURI external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Verify if a connection is still active.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $connection-id The identifier to the connection to be verify.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: Returns true if connected.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: jdbc:is-connected
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function jdbc:is-connected($connection-id as xs:anyURI) as xs:boolean external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns a set with options for a specified connection.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $connection-id The identifier to the connection to be verify.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: Returns and object with the connection options. The returned options are equal to the options specified in function jdbc:connect. Consequently, the options are specified as follows: { "autocommit" : xs:boolean, "readonly" : xs:boolean, "isolation-level" : xs:string }
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: jdbc:connection-options
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function jdbc:connection-options($connection-id as xs:anyURI) as object() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Commit current transaction from an active connection.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $connection-id The identifier to the connection to be commited.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: This function returns an empty-sequence()
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: jdbc:commit
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:sequential function jdbc:commit($connection-id as xs:anyURI) as empty-sequence() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Rollback the current transaction of a connection.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $connection-id The identifier to the connection to be rollbacked.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: This function returns an empty-sequence()
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: jdbc:rollback
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:sequential function jdbc:rollback($connection-id as xs:anyURI) as empty-sequence() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Executes any kind of SQL statement.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $connection-id The identifier to an active connection.
$sql The query string to be executed.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: Return an identifier that represents a DataSet.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: jdbc:execute
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:sequential function jdbc:execute($connection-id as xs:anyURI, $sql as xs:string) as xs:anyURI external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Executes non-updating SQL statements.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $connection-id The identifier to an active connection.
$sql The query string to be executed.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: Return an object with the result data rows from the query provided, the data rows are defined as follows: { column:value* }* Every row is represented by an object of column-value representation of the returned SQL result.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: SQL005 The statement is Updating type.
SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: jdbc:execute-query
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function jdbc:execute-query($connection-id as xs:anyURI, $sql as xs:string) as object()* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Executes updating SQL statements.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $connection-id The identifier to an active connection.
$sql The query string to be executed.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: Returns an xs:integer with the number of affected rows.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: SQL005 The statement is Read-only type.
SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: jdbc:execute-update
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function jdbc:execute-update($connection-id as xs:anyURI, $sql as xs:string) as xs:integer external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Creates a prepared statement for multiple executions with diferent values.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $connection-id The identifier to an active connection.
$sql The query string to be executed.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: Return an identifier that represents the prepared statement. Example: jsql:prepare-statement($connection, "SELECT * FROM users WHERE id=? AND age>?")
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: jdbc:prepare-statement
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:sequential function jdbc:prepare-statement($connection-id as xs:anyURI, $sql as xs:string) as xs:anyURI external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Set the value of the designated parameter with the given value, this function will assign only numeric values.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $prepared-statement The identifier to a prepared statement.
$parameter-index The index from the parameter to be set.
$value The value to be set.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: This function returns an empty-sequence()
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: jdbc:set-numeric
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:sequential function jdbc:set-numeric($prepared-statement as xs:anyURI, $parameter-index as xs:decimal, $value as xs:anyAtomicType) as empty-sequence() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Set the value of the designated parameter with the given value, this function will assign only string values.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $prepared-statement The identifier to a prepared statement.
$parameter-index The index from the parameter to be set.
$value The value to be set.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: This function returns an empty-sequence()
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: jdbc:set-string
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:sequential function jdbc:set-string($prepared-statement as xs:anyURI, $parameter-index as xs:integer, $value as xs:string) as empty-sequence() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Set the value of the designated parameter with the given value, this function will assign only boolean values.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $prepared-statement The identifier to a prepared statement.
$parameter-index The index from the parameter to be set.
$value The value to be set.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: This function returns an empty-sequence()
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: jdbc:set-boolean
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:sequential function jdbc:set-boolean($prepared-statement as xs:anyURI, $parameter-index as xs:integer, $value as xs:boolean) as empty-sequence() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Set the value of the designated parameter with the given value, this function will assign only null values if possible.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $prepared-statement The identifier to a prepared statement.
$parameter-index The index from the parameter to be set.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: This function returns an empty-sequence()
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: jdbc:set-null
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:sequential function jdbc:set-null($prepared-statement as xs:anyURI, $parameter-index as xs:integer) as empty-sequence() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Set the value of the designated parameter with the given value, this function will assign any value you send and it will try to cast to the correct type.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $prepared-statement The identifier to a prepared statement.
$parameter-index The index from the parameter to be set.
$value The value to be set.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: This function returns an empty-sequence()
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: jdbc:set-value
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:sequential function jdbc:set-value($prepared-statement as xs:anyURI, $parameter-index as xs:decimal, $value as xs:anyAtomicType) as empty-sequence() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Clears the current parameter values immediately.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $prepared-statement The identifier to a prepared statement.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: This function returns an empty-sequence()
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: jdbc:clear-params
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:sequential function jdbc:clear-params($prepared-statement as xs:anyURI) as empty-sequence() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Retrieves the number, types and properties of the prepared statement parameters.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $prepared-statement The identifier to a prepared statement.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: This function returns the parameters metadata associated with a prepared statement. In other words, it returns information about the column name associated with the parameter, the type, etc. The metadata node returned by this function is defined as follows: { columns: [{ "name": xs:string, "type": xs:string }] }
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: jdbc:parameter-metadata
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function jdbc:parameter-metadata($prepared-statement as xs:anyURI) as object() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Executes SQL statements prepared with 5.1 jsql:prepare-statement with values set and returns an identifier to a Dataset.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $prepared-statement The identifier to a prepared statement.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: Return an identifier that represents a DataSet.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: jdbc:execute-prepared
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:sequential function jdbc:execute-prepared($prepared-statement as xs:anyURI) as xs:anyURI external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Executes a non-updating SQL statement prepared with 5.1 jsql:prepare-statement.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $prepared-statement The identifier to a prepared statement.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: Return an object with the result data rows from the query processed with the parameter values provided, the data rows are defined as follows: { column:value* }* Every row is represented by an object of column-value representation of the returned SQL result.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: SQL005 The prepared statement is an updating query.
SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: jdbc:execute-query-prepared
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function jdbc:execute-query-prepared($prepared-statement as xs:anyURI) as object()* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Executes an updating SQL statement prepared with 5.1 jsql:prepare-statement.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $prepared-statement The identifier to a prepared statement.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: Returns an xs:integer with the number of affected rows.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: SQL006 The prepared statement is a non-updating query.
SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: jdbc:execute-update-prepared
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function jdbc:execute-update-prepared($prepared-statement as xs:anyURI) as xs:integer external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Closes and frees from memory any prepared SQL statement created with jdbc:prepare-statement
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $prepared-statement The identifier to a prepared statement.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: This function returns an empty-sequence()
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: jdbc:close-prepared
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:sequential function jdbc:close-prepared($prepared-statement as xs:anyURI) as empty-sequence() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This function returns a sequence of objects representing the rows of data from a non-updating query.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $dataset-id The identifier to a DataSet.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: Return an object with the result data rows from the DataSet provided, the data rows are defined as follows: { column:value* }* Every row is represented by an object of column-value representation of the returned SQL result.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: jdbc:result-set
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function jdbc:result-set($dataset-id as xs:anyURI) as object()* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Return the metadata of the result of a particular DataSet.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $dataset-id The identifier to a DataSet.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: This function returns the metadata associated with an executed DataSet. More in detail, it returns information about column names, types, and whether a column can contain a null value. The metadata information can only be returned for DataSets that have been executed explicitly using the jsql:execute function. The metadata node returned by this function is defined as follows: { "columns": [ { "name": xs:string, "type": xs:string, "autoincrement"? = xs:boolean, "nillable"? = xs:boolean } * ] }
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: jdbc:metadata
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function jdbc:metadata($dataset-id as xs:anyURI) as object() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Return the number of affected rows of a particular DataSet.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $dataset-id The identifier to a DataSet.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: Returns an xs:integer with the number of affected rows.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: jdbc:affected-rows
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function jdbc:affected-rows($dataset-id as xs:anyURI) as xs:integer external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Closes and free resources from a particular DataSet.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $dataset-id The identifier to a DataSet.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: This function returns an empty-sequence()
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: jdbc:close-dataset
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:sequential function jdbc:close-dataset($dataset-id as xs:anyURI) as empty-sequence() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Return the list of tables from a connection
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $connection-id The identifier to a connection.
$catalog A filter of the catalog name of the tables. Send empty-sequence for all tables.
$schema A filter of the schema name of the tables. Send empty-sequence for all tables.
$table A filter of the name of the tables. Send empty-sequence for all tables.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: Return an object with the result data rows from the query provided, the data rows are defined as follows: { column:value* }* Every row is represented by an object of column-value representation of the returned SQL result.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: jdbc:tables
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:sequential function jdbc:tables($connection-id as xs:anyURI, $catalog as xs:string?, $schema as xs:string?, $table as xs:string?) as object()* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Return the list of tables from a connection
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $connection-id The identifier to a connection.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: Return an object with the result data rows from the query provided, the data rows are defined as follows: { column:value* }* Every row is represented by an object of column-value representation of the returned SQL result.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: jdbc:tables
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:sequential function jdbc:tables($connection-id as xs:anyURI) as object()*
